Title: Developer Educator, Demos
Blurb:
.css-1noe2rc *{color:#505863;line-height:1.4em;}.css-1noe2rc .ecgq1xb1{padding-left:0;}.css-1noe2rc .ecgq1xb1 .ecgq1xb0{margin:0 0 8px 0;}.css-1noe2rc ol,.css-1noe2rc ul{padding-left:32px;}.css-1noe2rc li{margin:10px;margin-bottom:5px;margin-left:20px;line-height:1.4em;}.css-58vpdc{margin-bottom:24px;}.css-58vpdc ul{margin:5px 0 10px 20px;}.css-58vpdc ul > br{display:none;}.css-58vpdc ul > li{margin-left:0;}.css-58vpdc li{padding:0;}Because you belong at Twilio

The Who, What, Where and Why

You're a developer that enjoys empowering your peers. Some of your favorite projects during your career have likely been things like building MVPs, demo applications, or proofs of concepts. You get excited about starting the next project, incorporating what you've learned from the last ship.

We're looking for a Developer Educator to join our team and serve developers through technical demos. We're on a mission to challenge and empower developers to build the future of communications with Twilio APIs.

Who?

You are a developer. You love building applications, and equally importantly, sharing them with others. Beyond just showing what you've built, you're motivated to share how you built it so other developers are inspired to create their own experiences using your ideas.

You are a storyteller. You know that the best demos take someone on a journey that has a beginning, middle and end. You enjoy telling these stories on stage and online.

You are a collaborator. You're not hesitant to gather input from the people around you to help create the best experiences for your audience. You bring diverse voices to the conversation to ensure you build applications that aren't only reflective of yourself, but of our entire community.

As a Developer Educator for demos you will be driving, designing, and building both real world and visionary use cases using Twilio's powerful APIs and software platforms.

Specifically, we're looking for a developer with:


2+ years of experience in a software engineering or similar role
Backend development experience in either Node.js, C#, Python, or PHP
Frontend development experience with React
Experience building with REST APIs at scale
Comfortable giving live technical demos in front of an audience

What?

As a Developer Educator, you will live the Twilio Magic values:

BE AN OWNER & BE BOLD: You'll create the live demos Twilio uses at developer events. You'll work with stakeholders to create the narrative, write the code, and train developers throughout Twilio to take your demos to our community.

EMPOWER OTHERS: You'll also empower developers online by building interactive demos for our website, reaching an even larger audience as they start building on Twilio.

Specifically, in this role you will:


Build and iterate the demos we show at our Engage roadshow events
Craft the narrative and ship the demos that will be shown on the main stage at SIGNAL, our annual conference
Work closely with our partners across the company in Sales, Marketing, and Product
Iterate on our strategy for online interactive demos by shipping experiments and analyzing their results

Why?

Twilio is truly unique; we are a company committed to your growth, your learning, your development, and your entire employee experience. We only win when our employees succeed and we're dedicated to helping you develop your strengths. We invest in weeks dedicated to tackling hard problems and creating your own ideas. We have a cultural foundation built on diversity, inclusion, and innovation and we want you and your ideas to thrive at Twilio. Come join us.

Where?

Our team is fully distributed, so you will interact remotely with the Developer Education team. You will enjoy all of Twilio's incredible perks: monthly Kindle book reimbursement, monthly gym reimbursement, bi-weekly All Hands and more. Between our Superclass training events and team meetings, you will be expected to travel 1-2 times per quarter. We also believe that in order to do this job well, you need a balanced work and home life. We offer generous PTO. What you will also get to experience is a company that believes in small teams for maximum impact; that strives to balance work and home life, that understands that this is a marathon, not a sprint; that continuously and purposefully builds an inclusive culture where everyone is able to do and be the best version of themselves. We seek people who naturally demonstrate our values, who are challenged by problems, empower others to thrive, people who can draw the owl and not be beholden to one playbook.

About us:

Millions of developers around the world have used Twilio to unlock the magic of communications to improve any human experience. Twilio has democratized communications channels like voice, text, chat, video and email by virtualizing the world's communications infrastructure through APIs that are simple enough for any developer to use, yet robust enough to power the world's most demanding applications. By making communications a part of every software developer's toolkit, Twilio is enabling innovators across every industry  from emerging leaders to the world's largest organizations  to reinvent how companies engage with their customers.

Twilio is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, gender, gender identity, parental or pregnancy status, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or Veteran status and operate in compliance with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

Title: Technical Lead, Developer Experience
Blurb:
.css-1noe2rc *{color:#505863;line-height:1.4em;}.css-1noe2rc .ecgq1xb1{padding-left:0;}.css-1noe2rc .ecgq1xb1 .ecgq1xb0{margin:0 0 8px 0;}.css-1noe2rc ol,.css-1noe2rc ul{padding-left:32px;}.css-1noe2rc li{margin:10px;margin-bottom:5px;margin-left:20px;line-height:1.4em;}.css-58vpdc{margin-bottom:24px;}.css-58vpdc ul{margin:5px 0 10px 20px;}.css-58vpdc ul > br{display:none;}.css-58vpdc ul > li{margin-left:0;}.css-58vpdc li{padding:0;}Because you belong at Twilio.

The Who, What, Why and Where

Twilio has over 20 products that enable developers to build communications solutions into their custom workflows and apps. But communications are complicated, asynchronous systems and things can go wrong in very unexpected ways that a simple try/catch block can't always detect. And add on a contact center product like Flex--which is built on top of our platform primitives like Voice, SMS, and TaskRouter--and you have a dependency map that makes it incredibly hard to debug when something goes wrong.

With all of these products in an "always be deploying" mindset, our customers need to know when we're going to change things that might affect them. The Transparency team at Twilio exists to provide customers a best-in-class developer experience when debugging distributed systems and flawless communications about our ever-evolving product lineup.

Who?

Twilio is looking for a leader who lives the Twilio Magic and has a demonstrated track record of technical decision making and distributed systems architecture. They also have:


A passion for Developer Experience. They provide feedback when they find incorrect docs and aren't afraid to open issues and PRs against public SDKs.
Deep knowledge of 2+ object-oriented, compiled programming languages and 2+ interpreted languages.
7+ years experience owning, operating, deploying, and monitoring cloud-based RESTful microservices at scale; and have worked with technologies like Chef, Docker, or Terraform.
3+ years mentoring junior engineers with code reviews, software engineering best practices, and collaborative design.
A roll-up-the-sleeves mentality for digging into multiple codebases to get to the root of a problem.
Front-end experience with React, Redux, Typescript, or related technologies.
A preference for collaboration -- they find success in learning from others and helping them be successful.
Opinions and a high bar for software quality and availability, and connect the dots between those metrics and your customers' success.
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or similar experience

What?

As a Technical Lead, you will live the Twilio Magic values:


WRITE IT DOWN: You will write Engineering Design documents in collaboration with Product, and collaborate on product spec and user stories documents. You will also write thorough and well-scoped tickets with clear definitions of done for the rest of the engineering team.
DRAW THE OWL AND WEAR THE CUSTOMER'S SHOES: There is no instruction book for a lot of what the Transparency team is trying to solve. There might be some industry best practices, but we frequently have to wear our customer's shoes to propose solutions that meet their needs.
BE AN OWNER: As the Technical Lead, you are not only responsible for the architecture of the system, you are oncall for it. You care deeply about your services' performance and quality, and measure those characteristics rigorously with data.
EMPOWER OTHERS AND BE INCLUSIVE: The technical lead is the primary mentor for the team. You will spend much of your time setting standards, reviewing PRs, challenging the team to think big picture about what we build, and making sure all voices are heard.
RUTHLESSLY PRIORITIZE: You will have opinions about the tallest nails of technical risk our team carries, and can prioritize that risk against feature development and work to keep other services running.

Why?

Transparency is a unique type of team: we are both a platform team that ingests data from other product teams and a product team ourselves that builds tools to present that data to customers. And we do all of this at a massive scale. Internally, we empower and educate product teams with opinions on what good Developer Experience is. Externally, we push the envelope of how customers find out about issues and changes to their Twilio account. Joining this team will challenge you to think outside the box about technologies like data streaming and event-driven programming.

Twilio is a company that is empowering the world's developers with modern communication in order to build better applications. Twilio is truly unique; we are a company committed to your growth, your learning, your development, and your entire employee experience. We only win when our employees succeed and we're dedicated to helping you develop your strengths. We invest in weeks dedicated to tackling hard problems and creating your own ideas. We have a cultural foundation built on diversity, inclusion, and innovation and we want you and your ideas to thrive at Twilio.

Where?

This position will be located in our beautiful office at 1801 California St. in Denver, CO. You will enjoy our incredible perks: catered meals, snacks, game room, ergonomic desks, access to our building fitness center, monthly All Hands and more.

You will also be part of a company that believes in small teams for maximum impact; that strives to balance work and home life; that understands that this is a marathon, not a sprint; that continuously and purposefully builds an inclusive culture where everyone is able to do and be the best version of themselves. We seek people who naturally demonstrate our values, who are challenged by problems, empower others to thrive, and can draw the owl and not be beholden to one playbook.

About us:

Millions of developers around the world have used Twilio to unlock the magic of communications to improve any human experience. Twilio has democratized communications channels like voice, text, chat, video and email by virtualizing the world's communications infrastructure through APIs that are simple enough for any developer to use, yet robust enough to power the world's most demanding applications. By making communications a part of every software developer's toolkit, Twilio is enabling innovators across every industry  from emerging leaders to the world's largest organizations  to reinvent how companies engage with their customers.

Twilio is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, gender, gender identity, parental or pregnancy status, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or Veteran status and operate in compliance with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

Title: Senior Engineering Manager, Developer Experience Interfaces
Blurb:
.css-1noe2rc *{color:#505863;line-height:1.4em;}.css-1noe2rc .ecgq1xb1{padding-left:0;}.css-1noe2rc .ecgq1xb1 .ecgq1xb0{margin:0 0 8px 0;}.css-1noe2rc ol,.css-1noe2rc ul{padding-left:32px;}.css-1noe2rc li{margin:10px;margin-bottom:5px;margin-left:20px;line-height:1.4em;}.css-58vpdc{margin-bottom:24px;}.css-58vpdc ul{margin:5px 0 10px 20px;}.css-58vpdc ul > br{display:none;}.css-58vpdc ul > li{margin-left:0;}.css-58vpdc li{padding:0;} Because you belong at Twilio

The Who, What, Why and Where

Twilio's developer interfaces including the Console, helper libs and CLI are critical tools for our customers. When leveraged well, they serve as our primary touchpoint for communicating with customers and enabling them to easily build their Twilio applications. By crafting delightful developer interfaces, your work will empower and simplify the lives of our customers and form a critical part of our continued success.

Who?

The manager of the Developer Experience Interfaces teams will be a dynamic and inspiring engineering leader with a passion for delivering world-class solutions through management, mentorship, and influential leadership. Your teams will take a central role in imagining and delivering the next generation of the Twilio Console, creating experiences that are used by tens of thousands of customers on a daily basis.

You will grow and lead talented engineers with backgrounds in front end software development, quality engineering, and production operations.

You are a firm believer in the benefits of working through Agile and lean methodologies delivering small incremental customer value frequently.

Your passions include delivering top quality services with amazing reliability and operability, holding your team accountable to this high standard, and leveraging automation throughout the delivery lifecycle.

You believe in Servant Leadership and prioritize your responsibilities to hire great people, mentor through candid, caring, and timely feedback, and lead the teams to consistently deliver; you are also able to dig in and support your teams to solve hard technical problems and provide technical guidance as we scale.

You are an influencer and drive collaboration across the company, and you ensure the departmental strategy is set around supporting the needs of our customers.

You might be a fit if you have:


10+ years of relevant experience
3+ years of engineering management experience
Track record in building and sustaining high-performance teams
Deep understanding of web technologies like JavaScript, HTML, and CSS, and at least one JavaScript framework
Experience building and evolving developer-centric application interfaces
Fanatically customer-centered, and take a systems-level mindset to build consistent and usable interfaces across Twilio's Developer product suite
Success at participating in cross-functional teams; naturally collaborative but decisive when needed
Experience working in a distributed working environment

What?

As a Senior Engineering Manager of Developer Experience Interfaces teams we expect you will:


Manage and lead the Console & Dev Interfaces teams working collaboratively with peers across disciplines to meet business commitments.
Lead your teams through the design, development, testing, operability, code reviews, and deployment of features and components
Hire, manage, and mentor front end software engineers to foster their career growth and progression
Drive quality, predictability, and velocity on your teams with continuous improvement mindset
Collaborate with Product Management to define roadmap, priorities and User Stories
Live by and champion our cultural values of the Twilio Magic

Why?

Twilio believes in the power of Platforms to create leverage and empower developers. Our internal platforms enable our own small teams of developers to stand on the shoulders of giants, enabling them to focus on making world-class services that delight our customers.

Twilio is a company that is empowering the world's developers with modern communication in order to build better applications. Twilio is truly unique; we are a company committed to your growth, your learning, your development, and your entire employee experience. We only win when our employees succeed and we're dedicated to helping you develop your strengths. We invest in weeks dedicated to tackling hard problems and creating your own ideas. We have a cultural foundation built on diversity, inclusion, and innovation and we want you and your ideas to thrive at Twilio.

Where?

This position will be located in our office at 1801 California St in Denver, CO. You will enjoy our office perks: catered meals, snacks, game room, ergonomic desks, bi-weekly All Hands and more. What you will also get to experience is a company that believes in small teams for maximum impact; seeks well-rounded talent to ensure a full perspective on our customers' experience, understands that this is a marathon, not a sprint; that continuously and purposefully builds an inclusive culture where everyone is able to do and be the best version of themselves.

About us:

Founded in 2008, Twilio has over 2,000 employees, with headquarters in San Francisco and other offices in Bogot, Dublin, Hong Kong, London, Madrid, Mountain View, Munich, New York City, Prague, Singapore, Sydney, and Tallinn.

Millions of developers around the world have used Twilio to unlock the magic of communications to improve any human experience. Twilio has democratized communications channels like voice, text, chat, video and email by virtualizing the world's communications infrastructure through APIs that are simple enough for any developer to use, yet robust enough to power the world's most demanding applications. By making communications a part of every software developer's toolkit, Twilio is enabling innovators across every industry  from emerging leaders to the world's largest organizations  to reinvent how companies engage with their customers.

Twilio is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, gender, gender identity, parental or pregnancy status, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or Veteran status and operate in compliance with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

Who?

Who?

Twilio is looking for a senior software engineer who lives the Twilio Magic and has demonstrated track record of software delivery.


You have years of software development experience. We mostly use Java in back-end and Angular in front-end for our services, but we are open for wider experience as long as you are open minded.

WEAR THE CUSTOMER'S SHOES & DON'T SETTLE: You will be responsible for routing our customer messages the best way we can. You do your best every day and also expect it from the others.
EMPOWER OTHERS & NO SHENANIGANS: You will collaborate and empower other SMS Engineering teams based in Tallinn, Bogota and San Francisco and other Twilio teams that are globally distributed.

The Who, What, Why and Where

At Twilio, our mission is to power the future of communications. Twilio's Messaging platform enables companies to integrate omnichannel communications into their applications via easy to use APIs. We are looking for a Software Engineer to join our Messaging Core Infrastructure team in Tallinn who is passionate about designing, developing, deploying and operating software solutions at scale, and wants to help Twilio deliver the best user experience for next-generation communications.

Who?

Twilio is looking for an engineer who lives the Twilio Magic and is excited to take on complex engineering challenges in the fast-growing business of communications. From you as a candidate, we expect:


Scalable backend. You understand scalability challenges and the performance of server-side code. You can design and develop horizontally-scalable, resilient and performing-under-load systems.
Databases. You have experience with multiple storage technologies and can reason about how to choose the suitable storage technology for a given purpose.
Java. You are a Java enthusiast and professional. There is at least one framework in which you can be called an expert.
Cloud. You are proficient in cloud technologies and are hands-on in at least one cloud platform: GCP, AWS, or Azure. You are able to both design and develop cloud-based systems and operate them in an automated fashion.
Testing. You are passionate about quality and can engineer it at all stages of software development. You are able to design and develop a quality pipeline requiring as little human intervention as possible.
Operations. You like to own a domain end to end, including deploying and operating your services in production.
Communication and collaboration. You have strong communication skills and desire to make an impact and thrive in small, collaborative, energetic teams.

We welcome candidates with different levels of seniority and experience.

What?

As a software engineer in the Messaging Core Infrastructure team, you will design, implement and operate backend services that are the backbone of message delivery in Twilio.


DRAW THE OWL: Not every problem has a textbook solution. You will be expected to research the unknowns, implement and iterate. Educate your team as you go.
BE AN OWNER & BE BOLD: You will own the design, implementation and the operations of Messaging backend services, handling hundreds of millions of requests daily.
DON'T SETTLE:  Live and champion mature, high-quality engineering through writing tests, valuing code maintainability, documenting your work, etc
WRITE IT DOWN: Twilio is a global, fast-growing company that builds complex systems. To be successful in joining these globally built complex parts of the system, You will be expected to write down the requirements, design, implementation, etc.
EMPOWER OTHERS: You will primarily collaborate with other Messaging teams based in Tallinn and San Francisco and, of course, rest of the Twilio engineering globally.

Why?

Core services are the backbone of messages state and delivery. Being on the critical path for most Messaging product features, the core service's primary challenges focus around scalability, reliability and low latency. Choosing the right architecture and design for the services is a rewarding challenge that drives the engineers in the Core Infrastructure team!

Twilio is a company that is empowering the world's developers with modern communication in order to build better applications. Twilio is truly unique; we are a company committed to your growth, your learning, your development, and your entire employee experience. We only win when our employees succeed and we're dedicated to helping you develop your strengths. Who?

We are looking for versatile full-stack web software engineer with product thinking eager to bring first ever Twilio Messaging Mobile Apps to the market. You will be responsible for designing and building React Native applications, as well as collaborating with the teams responsible for SDKs and API layers of the Messaging infrastructure.


You are ready to learn and execute on multiple levels of software engineering: from websocket I/O to object lifecycle management, from low-level optimisations and debugging to interfaces and system design, from writing code to release management and assuring the quality of your work.
You take pride and ownership of React Native applications that have pure and intuitive user experience. You enjoy shipping your apps to Google Play and Apple App Store and taking user feedback.
You strive for building performant mobile applications on both the iOS and Android platforms. You know how to leverage native APIs for deep integration with operating system services.
You are eager to reach out to the open source community and help implement critical software fixes: React Native framework progresses quickly, sometimes with a few disruptions.

You will contribute to product development from end-user applications perspective: you will be designing and developing beautiful and consistent React Native Apps for millions of users around the world. You will work directly with engineering teams and with members of the product organisation to distill customer requirements into architecture, design, and development.

In this role you will build the premiere Twilio Messaging Mobile Apps with native feel, embed our web SDKs and interact with Twilio services. You will wear designer, coder, QA and product hats, and develop at multiple layers of software stack: networking, protocols, data modeling, business logic, public interfaces, UI components. There's much to learn, and much to be done! You must have at least 3 of the proficiencies below to be considered for the role:


React Native. You know what it takes to build a cross-platform mobile-first application. You strive for consistency and code reuse, and know-ins and outs of mobile frameworks. You are familiar with iOS and Android SDK and UI to get deep integration and native look & feel of the application.
JavaScript and TypeScript. You understand the intricacies and implications of TypeScript and JavaScript and follow development patterns of modern web community.
Testing and Releasing. You are passionate about quality and can engineer it at all stages of software development. You are able to design and develop quality pipeline requiring as little human intervention as possible.
User Interfaces and User Experience. You have a solid background in building responsive and consistent UI components with great user experience on mobile platforms. You can illustrate it with a few examples from your portfolio.
API Stack. You have experience in designing and implementing backend services exposing REST APIs and powering Client SDKs and Web front-ends.

The SDKs and Apps developed by the Messaging team are used by thousands of customers, both internal and external to Twilio. Your team will package and deliver best-in-class contact centre experience to disrupt the traditional monolithic application business. The Who, What, Why and Where

At Twilio, our mission is to power the future of communications. The Twilio's messaging platform enables companies to integrate omni-channel communications directly into their applications via simple cloud APIs and developer friendly SDKs. We are looking for a Software Engineer to join our Messaging Backend teams in Tallinn who is passionate about designing, developing, deploying and operating software solutions at scale, and wants to help Twilio deliver real-time, low latency capabilities for next-generation communications.

Who?

We're looking for versatile software engineers with product thinking eager to bring our cloud-hosted Software-As-A-Service API platform to new heights, powering our newest Twilio Conversations product revealed at Signal 2019.

Versatility means readiness to learn and execute on all levels of software engineering: from backend to client, from low-level optimizations and debugging to architecture and system design, from slinging code to operations and assuring the quality of your work.

Product thinking means taking pride and ownership of beautiful APIs that millions of developers can use around the world, as well as empathy for our customers and their businesses enabled by Twilio platform.

We welcome and incorporate people with different levels of seniority and experience.

What?

As a member of Conversational Messaging team, you will have an opportunity to work on highly-available, globally-distributed, and bulletproof-resilient infrastructure that powers Twilio's Conversations, Programmable Chat, Sync products, in addition to reinforcing internal customers. You will contribute to product development end-to-end: from working with members of the product organisation to distill customer requirements to architecture, design, and development. You'll also be accountable to operate the systems you've created live, devops-style.

In Conversations team, we believe in versatility and complementing proficiencies being key to forming a better team. We are therefore looking for people with a variety of skills, specializations and levels of seniority. You should have at least 3 of the proficiencies below to be considered for the role:


Java. You are a Java enthusiast and professional. There is at least one framework in which you can be called an expert.
Resiliency. You understand scalability challenges and performance of server-side code. You can design and develop horizontally-scalable, resilient and performing-under-load systems.
Cloud. You are proficient in cloud technologies and are hands-on in at least one cloud platform: GCC, AWS, or Azure. You are able to both design and develop cloud-based systems and operate them in an automated fashion.
Testing. You are passionate about quality and can engineer it at all stages of software development. You are able to design and develop quality pipeline requiring as little human intervention as possible.
Security. You are able to design secure distributed systems and assure operational processes around security. You understand fitness for purpose of security techniques.
Agile. You are an expert in practical aspects of running Scrum (or other agile methodologies) within a team and in a distributed cross-team environment.

In this role you will work with a flurry of cloud technologies offered by AWS, as well as by our own platform. DynamoDB, Cassandra, SQL, ElasticSearch, Redis, Lambda, ELBs (NLBs, ALBs), Kinesis, SQS, Kafka - we use practically everything on the menu. The vast majority of our backend code is in Java, and we use DropWizard and Nginx to terminate API requests and HAProxy for cross-service communication. Our clients are built in JavaScript, C++, Objective C, SWIFT, Java/JNI, and .NET.

Why?

The services and APIs developed by the Conversational backend teams are used by thousands of customers, both internal and external to Twilio. Our infrastructure powers aspect of Conversations, Flex and works in concert with Programmable Messaging suite.

Twilio empowers the world's developers with modern communication tools, helping them to build better applications. Twilio is unique: we are a company committed to your entire employee experience. We win when our employees succeed and we're dedicated to helping you cultivate your strengths. This means we will trust you to invest in complex solutions where we need them, and we'll rely on and encourage creativity. We have a culture founded on diversity, inclusion, and innovation, and we want you and your ideas to thrive at Twilio. Join us!

Where?

This position will be located in our new beautiful and well-designed office at Veerenni 38 in Tallinn. You will enjoy our incredible perks: monthly breakfast, twice a week lunch, dinner during our bi-weekly global All Hands and a fully-stocked kitchen with a variety of snacks and beverages. We offer true ownership of your own work, great salary package, Twilio RSUs (stock, NYSE: TWLO), mobile phone and gym reimbursement, monthly mobile expense coverage, monthly health expense coverage, on-boarding training in San Francisco etc. We also offer relocation help for you and your family if needed.

What you will also get to experience is a company that believes in small teams for maximum impact; that strives to balance work and home life, that understands that this is a marathon, not a sprint; that continuously and purposefully builds an inclusive culture where everyone is able to do and be the best version of themselves. We seek people who naturally demonstrate our values, who are challenged by problems, empower others to thrive, people who can draw the owl and not be beholden to one playbook. Do you want to experience all of this with the best people? Join our really diverse, international team in Tallinn!

About us:

Millions of developers around the world have used Twilio to unlock the magic of communications to improve any human experience. Twilio has democratized communications channels like voice, text, chat, video and email by virtualizing the world's communications infrastructure through APIs that are simple enough for any developer to use, yet robust enough to power the world's most demanding applications. By making communications a part of every software developer's toolkit, Twilio is enabling innovators across every industry  from emerging leaders to the world's largest organizations  to reinvent how companies engage with their customers.

Twilio is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, gender, gender identity, parental or pregnancy status, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or Veteran status.

The Who, What, Where and Why

Who?

This is an internship opportunity for the Summer of 2020. You will be working in a rapidly evolving and fast-paced environment, with a team that is implementing a reliable, auto-scaling, software-based telephony application stack on top of commodity cloud computing resources such as Amazon's EC2. Twilio looks for Software Engineers who live the Twilio Magic and who want to design, develop, deploy and operate software solutions and help Twilio deliver real-time, low latency capabilities for next-generation communications.

Qualifications:


Working towards a BS, MS, or PhD degree in computer science, computer engineering or a related field.
Love of software development with several side projects and you may even be in the open source community.
A hungry entrepreneurial and "can do" spirit, as evidenced by successful interest in learning new technologies.

Teams Hiring -

FLEX - brings together a handful of Twilio's product suite to power a next generation contact center solution. Their team's work across the stack from challenges of call routing on the back-end to the look and feel of a call agent's dashboards with it's customizable UI.

MESSAGING - Twilio is known for SMS and larger Messaging platform (read WhatsApp, Facebook etc), and as an engineer on the Messaging team you will have hands-on impact on the largest product offered to Twilio's customers. Messaging volume has increased 10x on Twilio's platform in the previous few years.

SUPER NETWORK - simplifies, strengthens and unites carrier communication networks using software. Build on top of a battle-tested infrastructure with redundancy at every level of the stack. Our intelligent infrastructure and the advantages of a cloud architecture provides confidence to our customers.

The team works closely with senior leadership and every Twilio product engineering team to deliver software capabilities that free our developers to focus on their products and their customers. One of our teams that is hiring is our Observability team. This team focuses on developing and maintaining observability and telemetry tools for the Twilio Platform. Observability is building high scale mission-critical software that helps to observe infrastructure and microservices.

What?

As a Software Engineer Intern you will experience the following -


Be a Software Engineer, not just an "intern".
Ship many different projects during your summer.
Engineers at Twilio solve problems in distributed computing, real-time DSP (audio processing), virtualization performance, distributed messaging, busses and more.
During your internship, you will be given responsibility for core features and services that ship to our users.
You will be expected to embrace these challenges, learn fast and deliver great results.
You will bring a willingness to learn and grow and we will reciprocate with ample opportunity to do just that, in a friendly, fun and exciting startup environment!
Learn to develop beautiful and profitable applications.

The Who, What, Why and Where

At Twilio, our mission is to power the future of communications. Twilio's Super Network simplifies, strengthens and unites carrier communication networks using software. We are looking for a talented and passionate Senior Software Engineer who is excited about the opportunity to join the Super Network Monitoring team based in Tallinn, Estonia, to solve some of the hardest engineering problems at Twilio. The team is building scalable solutions that provide insights into the performance of our telecom partners and is tasked with ensuring the resiliency of the entire Super Network.

Who?

Twilio is looking for a Senior Software Engineer who lives the Twilio Magic and has:


3+ years of software development experience in Java or Scala.
Experience in at least one of the cloud platforms - AWS, Azure, GCP.
Proficiency in building and running resilient and scalable back-end services in a production environment.
2+ years of experience in data streaming and analytics technologies like Kafka, Kinesis, Spark, Flink, KSQL, Elasticsearch or others.
Curiosity about Machine Learning.
Passion about code quality and software development best practices. Has the desire to ship products using continuous integration, continuous delivery and test automation.

What?

As a Senior Software Engineer, you will live the Twilio Magic values:


BE INCLUSIVE, EMPOWER OTHERS: Work in a small, high-impact, multi-talented engineering team.
DRAW THE OWL: Collaborate with your Tech Lead and other Software Engineers to tackle complex problems in distributed computing.
BE AN OWNER:

Build, deploy and operate your team's services in a production environment in the DevOps model.
Ensure quality by writing unit, integration, and load tests

DON'T SETTLE, RUTHLESSLY PRIORITIZE: Apply Agile methodologies to continuously deliver value to the customers.

Why?

Twilio has democratized communications channels like voice, text, chat, and video by virtualizing the world's telecommunications infrastructure through APIs that are simple enough for any developer to use, yet robust enough to power the world's most demanding applications.

Twilio's Super Network team is responsible for providing and managing the telco connectivity and services that power the Programmable Communications Cloud and Engagement Cloud products. We do this by ensuring the network remains healthy, provides the coverage and capabilities customers require and operates in a cost-efficient manner.

Twilio is truly unique; we are a company committed to your growth, your learning, your development, and your entire employee experience. We only win when our employees succeed and we're dedicated to helping you develop your strengths. We invest in weeks dedicated to tackling hard problems and creating your own ideas. This position will be located in our new beautiful and well designed office at Veerenni 38 in Tallinn. You will enjoy our incredible perks: monthly breakfast, twice a week lunch, dinner during our bi-weekly global All Hands and a fully-stocked kitchen with a variety of snacks and beverages. We have many team building events weekly, monthly and of course annual summer days. What you will also get to experience is a company that believes in small teams for maximum impact; that strives to balance work and home life, that understands that this is a marathon, not a sprint; that continuously and purposefully builds an inclusive culture where everyone is able to do and be the best version of themselves. Twilio has democratized communications channels like voice, text, chat, and video by virtualizing the world's telecommunications infrastructure through APIs that are simple enough for any developer to use, yet robust enough to power the world's most demanding applications. By making communications a part of every software developer's toolkit, Twilio is enabling innovators across every industry  from emerging leaders to the world's largest organizations  to reinvent how companies engage with their customers. Title: Java Developer Supervisor
Blurb:
Position:
Java Developer Supervisor
Job Description:
Black Knight is the premier provider of integrated technology, services, data and analytics that lenders and servicers look to first to help successfully manage the entire loan life cycle. Defines and manages resource requirements and allocations, monitors and improves quality, and ensures 'best practice' development techniques. Works closely with client departments in development and implementation of Black Knight's mortgage web service platform that interacts with mortgage application programs and products having impact on improving the business. The Java Developer Supervisor will lead and manage a team of Java Developers in an enterprise software company.
GENERAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES
Coordinates Java systems analysis and applications development activities through direct and indirect staff.
Partners with business and technology leadership to define, prioritize and achieve strategic objectives related to approval application development projects and platforms.

Experience with project management
Ability to communicate well both verbally and in writing to technical and non-technical audiences of various levels within Black Knight or outside the organization (executives, regulators, clients, etc.)
Results oriented, business focused, and successful at interfacing across multiple organizational units

Working experience using the following eLearning and multi-media development tools:
Captivate
Audio applications such as Audition, Audacity, or Soundbooth
Video editing tools, such as Premier Pro, MovieMaker
Graphic design tools such as InDesign, Photoshop, Illustrator, or Snag It
Familiarity with the basic concepts of user experience design
Familiarity with micro-learning and rapid-design strategies
ADDITIONAL EXPERIENCE PREFERRED
Prior Mortgage or Home Equity Originations or Servicing experience,
Working experience using eLearning and multi-media development tools such as:
Web or Mobile design tools (Adobe XD or Acrobat DC)
Storyline
Experience with help and authoring tools required; MadCap Flare preferred
Experience supporting software/application release documentation
Experience working with Mortgage Originations or Operations or Home Equity industry business process owners
Experience with TFS
Functional knowledge of the following applications/software preferred:
Empower
Expedite
Exchange
Compass Analytics
Ernst
GENERAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES
Conducts and analyzes training needs assessments following conventional instructional design methodologies.
Interviews business owners, business analysts, system developers, and other functional and technical personnel as part of the needs assessment.
Develops a solid understanding of Black Knight products to complete task analysis and determine training requirements.
Determines and documents the appropriate instructional strategy and project scope based on a completed needs assessment.
Reviews and accurately interprets technical documentation including use case scenarios, functional specifications, system specifications, and technical specifications as they pertain to course development.
Designs effective instructional materials, interactions, simulations and assessments to support the required instructional strategy.
Interacts with product managers, subject-matter experts, application development teams, business analysts, management, and others as needed to determine the scope of a project and to ensure accuracy and timely delivery of training programs.
Uses state of the art tools and technologies for the development, maintenance, production, and distribution of multi-media training materials/web-based training content.
Follows best practices in technical development to ensure a consistent development process.
Follows best practices in project management to develop and track project schedules using a consistent project management methodology.
Creates technical specifications for projects using approved templates and processes.
Writes, executes, and analyzes usability studies and test plans related to course materials, e-learning strategies, and learning management systems/client training portals.
Designs and develops criterion-based training assessments.
Assesses feedback from learners to evaluate and improve effectiveness of training.
Responsible for management, coordination, and troubleshooting of all aspects of client learning management systems/client training portals, and training related websites (i.e.; intranet, extranet), including communication with internal and external users.
Markets training courses and services to clients.
Performs other related duties as assigned.
EDUCATIONAL GUIDELINES
Bachelor's degree or the equivalent combination of education, training, and work experience. Degrees may include Instructional Design, Instructional Technologies, Education, Human Performance Technology, Journalism, Technical Writing, Web Design and Development, or other related degree. Certification programs may include CPLP or other Instructional Systems Design programs.
GENERAL KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES
Thorough knowledge of instructional design principles and methodology
Understanding of adult education concepts
Basic understanding of banking and financial services industries
Knowledge of information design and mapping concepts
Research and analysis skills; analytical, problem solving skills
Technical aptitude
Experience in eLearning development
Skill in preparation of course material for all training modalities (written manuals, online content, etc.)
Skill in designing and developing simulation-based/web-based training, including storyboarding, scripting, editing
Skill in developing training assessments that effectively measure learner comprehension
Skill in production and quality control using approved templates, processes and corporate standards
Project management skills, including scope definition, risk assessment, estimating, and reporting; ability to prioritize and complete tasks; strong time management skills
Written and verbal communication skills, including editing course content for correct punctuation, syntax, and grammar
Creativity and an aptitude for graphic and visual design appropriate to the business environment and training audience
Proficient with authoring, design, and development tools and technology, as well as programming languages and applications related to training development
Ability to objectively evaluate course content /feedback, and to make improvements based on results
Ability to establish and maintain effective, professional working relationships with employees and clients, including negotiation skills
Team skills, including the ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with all levels within the organization, internally and externally
Flexibility, versatility, dependability
Instructional Designer II
Intermediate professional role. Moderate skills with high level of proficiency. Understands and uses course development tools and technologies at an intermediate level. Works under general supervision with increased latitude for independent judgment. May consult with senior peers on certain projects. Works on multiple concurrent projects, of medium complexity, and in multiple product areas (3- 5). Assists on custom training development projects. Keeps informed of product development activities to identify and implement revisions, corrections, and changes in existing course content. Responsible for reviewing, analyzing, and applying client feedback to course content with direction.
Provides project status reports to management or senior peers. Is an active team member, contributes to complex projects to gain experience, shares ideas and suggests process improvements appropriate to the level of experience. Typically requires four (4) or more years of experience in instructional design, course development, technical communications, or a related field.
Black Knight is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, and protected veteran or military family status. Our employees diversity is our strength, and when we embrace our differences, it makes us better and brighter. Black Knights commitment to inclusion is at the core of who we are, and motivates us in how we do business each and every day.
Location:
Jacksonville, FL
Time Type:
Full time

Blurb:
Abschlussarbeit  Softwareentwicklung Java, Python, Machine Learning
 
 Job-ID: TP-T-3305
 
 Abschlussarbeit  Softwareentwicklung Java, Python, Machine Learning
 
 Studenten  Abschlussarbeit 
 Berlin

 Sie mchten im Rahmen einer Abschlussarbeit Ihre Kenntnisse in folgenden Themenbereichen vertiefen:
 
  Agile Entwicklung von Softwaremodulen auf Basis von Java und/oder Python sowie gngigen Webtechnologien

  Ablage von Daten in einem verteilten Dateisystem (Hadoop HDFS)
  Stream Processing (Apache Flink)
  Containervirtualisierung (Docker)
 
 Das spricht fr Sie:
 
 Fortgeschrittenes Studium im Bereich Informatik, Softwareentwicklung oder eines vergleichbaren Studienganges
 Sichere Anwendung von integrierten Entwicklungsumgebungen (Eclipse, Intellij, ...), Build-Management-Systemen (Gradle, Maven, Jenkins, ...) und Verwaltungstools (GitLab, Bitbucket, Jira, Confluence, ...)
 Sehr gute Programmierkenntnisse (Java, Python, ...) fr die Umsetzung von Analytik-Verfahren (Hauptkomponentenanalyse, Kalman-Filter, Gaussprozesse, ...)
 Grundkenntnisse in der selbstndigen Entwicklung von interaktiven Webanwendungen (JavaScript, ...)
 Grundverstndnis der Systematik des maschinellen Lernens
 Sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse
 Selbststndige und strukturierte Arbeitsweise 
 
 Das spricht fr uns:
 
 Als Student* arbeiten Sie bei IAV nicht irgendwo, sondern mittendrin. In echten Projekten. An spannenden Zukunftsaufgaben. Voll integriert und im Schulterschluss mit IAV-Experten. Viel Verantwortung und gleichzeitig viel Freiraum, um Uni und Arbeit zusammen zu bringen: So entstehen beste Perspektiven fr Ihre berufliche Entwicklung. Bei attraktiver Vergtung nach unserem Haustarifvertrag.
 
 * Wir freuen uns ber Menschen jeden Geschlechts.

Title: Android Software Entwickler*
Company: IAV GmbH Ingenieurgesellschaft Auto und Verkehr
Blurb:
IAV  Android Software Entwickler*
 
 Job-ID: TE-U4-SAM-1841
 
 Android Software Entwickler*
 
 Berufserfahrene  Vollzeit 
 Berlin 
 
 Das bewegt Sie:
 
 Wir bei IAV lieben Software. Wir verstehen uns als Software Craftsmen und schreiben unseren Code stehts "clean". Den Spagat zwischen traditionellem Entwicklungsvorgehen und der gleichzeitigen Anwendung agiler Methoden meistern wir tglich in selbstorganisierten Teams.
 
 Gemeinsam entwickeln wir das Smartphone auf Rdern. Fr kommende Fahrzeuggenerationen untersuchen wir schon heute, wie wir das wichtigste Interface des Fahrers zum Auto auf die nchste Stufe heben. Aktuell entwickeln wir "from scratch" einen Prototypen eines Infotainmentsystems auf Basis von Android Automotive. Gestalten Sie mit uns das Infotainment von bermorgen!
 
 Folgende konkrete Aufgaben erwarten Sie:
 
 Entwicklung einer HMI auf Basis von Android Automotive - vom Prototypen bis zum (virtuellen) Autohaus
 Erstellung einer flexiblen Software-Architektur, die viele unterschiedliche Bedienkonzepte erlaubt
 Aufbereitung technischer Details fr die Management-Flughhe
 Aktiver Wissenstransfer der neuen Technologie zu anderen Kollegen
 
 Das spricht fr Sie:
 
 Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium der Fachrichtungen (technische) Informatik, Medieninformatik, Elektrotechnik oder eines vergleichbaren Studienganges
 Fundierte Erfahrung in der professionellen Entwicklung (mindestens 2 Jahre) von Android Apps in mittleren oder groen Teams
 Sie knnen gute Software in Java oder Kotlin schreiben
 Nach Bedarf wechseln Sie die Flughhe und knnen so je nach Bedarf an einem wichtigen Detail oder an den nchsten groen Schritten arbeiten
 Idealer Weise haben Sie auch schon einen Einblick in andere Domnen gewonnen (insbesondere Backend- oder Web-Entwicklung)
 Sehr gute Deutsch- oder Englischkenntnisse
 
 Das spricht fr uns:
 
 Verantwortung bernehmen statt Rdchen im Getriebe sein. Bei IAV vertrauen wir Ihnen step by step immer wichtigere Aufgaben an. Dank Fach-Mentoren sind Sie nicht allein und knnen so mit den Projekten wachsen. Sie arbeiten mit den groen Namen der Automobil- und Forschungswelt zusammen.  * Wir freuen uns ber Menschen jeden Geschlechts.

Title: Senior Full Stack Web Developer
Blurb:
CMT is seeking a Full-Stack Web Developer to produce scalable software solutions to reliably collect and manage data from sensors on smartphones and connected devices in vehicles. As a Full-Stack Web Developer, you will design architecture, build front end applications, and build features and applications that meet the needs of our customers. If youre interested in using your skills to make the world's roads and drivers safer, wed like to meet you.

Responsibilities
Work with development teams and product managers to ideate software solutions
Design client-side and server-side architecture
Build the front-end of applications through appealing visual design
Develop and manage well-functioning databases and applications
Write effective APIs
Test software to ensure responsiveness and efficiency
Troubleshoot, debug and upgrade software
Create security and data protection settings
Build features and applications with a mobile responsive design
Requirements
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience
3+ years of relevant working experiences in web application development and programming
Top-notch programming skills and knowledge of modern HTML/CSS
Proficiency with Python and JavaScript
Knowledge of, and ability to use, relational database systems
Good understanding of how web applications work
Nice to have skills

Strong knowledge in web security and session management
Ability to work independently when needed
Ability to learn quickly
Familiarity with PHP
Hands-on experience with network diagnostics, network analytics tools
Benefits
Cambridge Mobile Telematics' (CMT) mission is to make the worlds roads and drivers safer. Since its first product launch in 2012 that pioneered mobile usage-based insurance, CMT has become the worlds leading telematics and analytics provider for insurers, rideshares, and fleets. CMTs DriveWell platform uses mobile sensing and behavioral science to measure driving risk and incentivize safer driving, while its Claims Studio reduces the claims cycle time with real-time crash detection, crash reconstruction, and damage assessment using telematics and artificial intelligence. CMT has over 50 active programs with insurers and other partners, improving safety for millions of drivers every day around the world. Started based on research at MIT and backed by the SoftBank Vision Fund to fuel its rapid growth, CMT is headquartered in Cambridge MA. To learn more, visit www.cmtelematics.com and follow CMT on Twitter @cmtelematics.
Our Benefits Include:
Health Care Plan (Medical, Dental & Vision)
Retirement Plan (401k match)
Life Insurance (Basic & AD&D)
Unlimited Paid Time Off (Vacation, Sick & Public Holidays)
Parental Leave
Short Term & Long Term Disability
Work From Home
Flexible Scheduling Options
Stock Option Plan

Title: Embedded Software Engineer?- 62347

Your Position:

As an Embedded Software Engineer for John Deere Construction and Forestry Division, located in Dubuque, IA, you will develop embedded software applications for Construction & Forestry equipment. In addition, you will:

Function: Information Technology

Title: Staff Software Engineer?- 56573?

Your Responsibilities

?As a Staff Software Engineer, for the John Deere Intelligent Solutions Group (ISG-San Francisco), you will join our team building a world class data platform for advanced analytics and artificial intelligence. This team will design, develop, and support our Precision Ag analytics platform - enabling the ingest, modeling, and efficient retrieval of data at petabyte scale. Our team builds production data products that utilize machine learning algorithms to enable intelligent, automated equipment and to improve farmer decision making. Join a team that is passionate about making a difference by applying cutting edge technology to solve some of the world's biggest problems. ?In addition, you will:

Write clean, well-tested code to enable ingest, storage, retrieval, and transformation of large-scale geospatial data for analysis, research, and model development.Build and support high performance data pipelines that are efficient and reliable with robust monitoring. Develop next-generation data structures and APIs that enable secure, performant, cost effective access to data for research and model development. Identify and adopt engineering best practices to drive high performance and high expectations from other engineers. Collaborate and communicate closely with data scientists and engineers to identify and build needed infrastructure, tools, and libraries to support machine learning algorithms. Provide code reviews and technical guidance to other members of the team.

VISA Sponsorship IS available for this position.

What Skills You Need

5 or more years of software engineering experience 3 or more years of experience building and supporting mission critical, global, production-scale, cloud-based systems using Amazon Web Services (AWS) or relevant cloud technologiesDemonstrated ability to architect and build large scale processing pipelines Experience designing and implementing geospatial data structures, analysis systems, and visualizations Strong coding skills in Python and additional experience with C++, Java, and/or Scala Demonstrated experience with infrastructure-as-code, automation, monitoring, and a DevOps mindset A solid foundation in computer science, particularly with algorithm development Strong analytic skills with high attention to detail and accuracy An ability to inform and influence others through your strong communication skills

What Makes You Stand Out

Expertise with geospatial, IoT, or high frequency unstructured data sets Sense of ownership, curiosity, and ability to function in a fast paced, collaborative team environment that is distributed across various time zones and locations Experience with Spark or Hadoop Experience working with GDAL or similar spatial libraries Experience with machine learning techniques or tools A strong track record of contributions to the open source community Advanced degree, engineering or computer science preferred

Education (or equivalent work experience)

Bachelor's degree in an Engineering, Computer Science or Technology related discipline

Title: Senior Software Engineer - Network Modeling
Blurb:
.css-1noe2rc *{color:#505863;line-height:1.4em;}.css-1noe2rc .ecgq1xb1{padding-left:0;}.css-1noe2rc .ecgq1xb1 .ecgq1xb0{margin:0 0 8px 0;}.css-1noe2rc ol,.css-1noe2rc ul{padding-left:32px;}.css-1noe2rc li{margin:10px;margin-bottom:5px;margin-left:20px;line-height:1.4em;}.css-58vpdc{margin-bottom:24px;}.css-58vpdc ul{margin:5px 0 10px 20px;}.css-58vpdc ul > br{display:none;}.css-58vpdc ul > li{margin-left:0;}.css-58vpdc li{padding:0;}The Network Modeling team, part of Technology Infrastructure, is responsible

for providing frameworks, tools, and applications to enable network and

security engineers to effectively manage one of the largest private networks

through automation. Our philosophy is to treat infrastructure as code -- we

build a software model of hardware devices and components and how they are

connected to each other to support Bloomberg Professional and related services.

What's in it for you:

This is a unique opportunity to help build robust, high-scale systems which

will power the future of Bloomberg's automated network infrastructure. You'll

be trusted to define standards, frameworks, libraries and tools as well as

architectural designs and solutions to some of the fields most challenging

problems.

We'll trust you to:
Actively contribute in defining both tools and architectural designs used


by the team

Encourage, mentor and train junior team members.
Practice and promote the use of a modern software development lifecycle
Engage with customers to capture and refine requirements
Autonomously develop technical solutions to achieve objectives and


required service levels, performance, and economics

Proactively research and follow industry trends, best practices, and open


source projects in network automation

You need to have:

3-5 years experience as a senior software engineer, preferably full stack


for a mission-critical production system

Expertise in software development in some combination of C/C++ or Python
Extensive knowledge in software testing and delivery best practices
The ability to take ownership and responsibility of issues and handle


them effectively to resolution

We'd love to see:

Contributions to Open Source projects especially related to Automation.
Knowledge in major Python frameworks like Django, Celery and Javascript


based front-end frameworks such as React.js

Systems and network troubleshooting capabilities such as packet captures,


strace, traceroute, and latency analysis

A keen interest in keeping abreast of technological advances and proven


success at incorporating new technology into existing systems

Knowledge of Linux programming, networking and system administration
If this sounds like something you would be passionate about apply! We'll get in

touch with you to let you know what the next steps are.

Bloomberg is an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company.

We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin,

gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability

status.

Title: Full Stack Developer
Blurb:
A rapidly-growing company based in New York City is looking to add a full time experienced Full Stack Developer to our team.
This specific position mainly focuses on development & implementation of our e-commerce site.
The selected candidate will be responsible for developing and maintaining applications using Vue, SCSS, and JavaScript on the front end, along with integrating APIs and advancing various systems and components with node.js on the backend.
High-quality development, testing and maintenance services of e-commerce site that also features medical education videos and a dedicated forum.
Responsibilities also include collaborating with our design team, writing unit tests, and performing code reviews.
Balancing a combination of innovation and new feature development with maintenance of existing technology.
You are an ideal candidate if:
You have a strong academic record (CS degree preferred but not required with relevant experience)
You have at least 1-2 years of full stack experience.
You are versatile
You care about User Experience (UX) and take pride in exceeding the user's expectationsCompensation
Competitive Salary, TBD
An awesome job that can grow with you
A team environment

Title: Microbusiness Ecommerce Developer
Company: Vimenti by Boys & Girls Clubs of Puerto Rico
Blurb:
.css-1noe2rc *{color:#505863;line-height:1.4em;}.css-1noe2rc .ecgq1xb1{padding-left:0;}.css-1noe2rc .ecgq1xb1 .ecgq1xb0{margin:0 0 8px 0;}.css-1noe2rc ol,.css-1noe2rc ul{padding-left:32px;}.css-1noe2rc li{margin:10px;margin-bottom:5px;margin-left:20px;line-height:1.4em;}.css-58vpdc{margin-bottom:24px;}.css-58vpdc ul{margin:5px 0 10px 20px;}.css-58vpdc ul > br{display:none;}.css-58vpdc ul > li{margin-left:0;}.css-58vpdc li{padding:0;}Are you eager to be part of Puerto Rico's social and economic transformation? Are you passionate about being a change agent and helping others strive to attain their goals and be successful? If yes, the Microbusiness Ecommerce Developer position is the perfect job opportunity for you.

The person on this position will design and identify the best ecommerce web platform, together with payment gateway and user interface experience. Responsible for the launch and continued development, technical maintenance and adequate software and hardware updates for the e-commerce platform. Identify the best benchmarks and trends for user interface experiences. Aid in the development of marketing and sales campaigns for the ecommerce customers (entrepreneurs). Aid in the development of a plan for the ecommerce platform sustainability. Identify and implement the best logistics for inventory and distribution of services and goods displayed at the ecommerce platform.

ESSENTIAL TASKS AND RESPONSIBILITIES

1. Design the eCommerce user interface and identify the best software platform and payment gateway.

2. Continued maintenance and update of the platform, software and hardware.

3. Build a strong relationship with the user/customers of the eCommerce platform, understand needs, trends and major roadblocks to the best experience.

4. Identify the best distribution channels and logistics to deliver service and goods to customers.

5. Design and maintain an inventory service of goods placed and sale at the eCommerce platform.

6. Provide periodic sales reports and any other relevant information to the E-HUB Manger.

7. Aid in the development of sales campaigns, marketing efforts and other promotional initiatives to support the eCommerce platform branding.

8. Provide guidance and support to the user/customers of the eCommerce platform as they launch and display their micro-businesses.

REQUIREMENTS

EDUCATION Y/O EXPERIENCE: Bachelors in information technology, software development or related field. Experience in eCommerce, payment gateways and customer interface development.

KNOWLEDGE SKILLS AND ABILITIES: Strong communications skills, Both English and Spanish. Considerable experience in web page development, eCommerce and payment gateway implementation. Some experience in digital marketing and/or social media management. Able to identify users needs and propose innovative solutions to increase customers satisfaction. Knowledgeable in most common eCommerce platforms (i.e. WIX, BIGCOMMERCE, Shopify, etc.). Also knowledgeable in most used web page languages (JAVA Script, Python, etc.) payment gateways and SEO platforms.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS: Individuals may need to sit or stand as needed. The position may require walking primarily on a level surface for periodic periods throughout the day. May reach above shoulder heights or below the waist and lift as required to file documents or store materials throughout the workday and must be able to lift 15 pounds and use proper lifting techniques.

MENTAL DEMANDS: Observing, receiving, and otherwise obtaining information from all relevant sources. Identifying the underlying principles, reasons, or facts of information by breaking down information or data into separate parts. Analyzing information and evaluating results to choose the best solution and solve problems.

ORGANIZATIONAL COMPETENCIES

STRATEGIC PLANNING: Uses data, metrics and critical analysis to solve problems that allow the achievement of organizational goals.

COMPLIANCE PROCESSES: Makes quality reports, which includes but is not limited to: reporting in Balance Scorecard, metrics and reports to investors, allies, and/or other required by the organization.

QUALITY: Proactive in identifying and establishing improvements strategies, uses data to guide decisions and ensures that processes are effective.

SECURITY: Ensures physical, psychological and emotional security in the organization by recognizing, reacting and reporting.

ORGANIZATIONAL VALUES

ANTICIPATES PROBLEMS: Detects errors, gaps and potential failures.

HANDLES CHANGES: Adapt to new methods, systems and processes to improve their performance.

DIRECTED TO RESULTS: Meets the goal, completes tasks and achieves results.

INNOVATIVE: Stimulates creative ideas and perspectives that add value.

COMMITMENT: Demonstrates loyalty and commitment through enthusiasm and effort.

CAPITALIZES ON THE SKILLS OF OTHERS: Gets along well with others, is sensible and behaves appropriately in social situations.

FOCUSES ON QUALITY: Aimed at achieving quality standards and creating excellent work products.

DEVELOP RELATIONSHIPS: Creates collaborative relationships to facilitates present as well as the future objectives.

SELF-DEVELOPMENT: Actively acquires new knowledge and skills to stay updated and grow beyond job requirements.

WORK IN TEAM: Collaborates with others to achieve goals and purposes.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $30,000.00 /year

Business Administration: 5 years (Preferred)service and good distribution channels and logistics: 1 year (Required)inventory service of good sold at eCommerce platforms: 1 year (Required)design of eCommerce user interface: 1 year (Required)eCommerce platforms: 1 year (Required)eCommerce updates and maintenance: 1 year (Required)

Bachelor's (Required)

Title: Risk & Collections Analyst (m/f) | Hamburg
Senior Data Engineer (m/f) | Hamburg
Blurb:
.css-1noe2rc *{color:#505863;line-height:1.4em;}.css-1noe2rc .ecgq1xb1{padding-left:0;}.css-1noe2rc .ecgq1xb1 .ecgq1xb0{margin:0 0 8px 0;}.css-1noe2rc ol,.css-1noe2rc ul{padding-left:32px;}.css-1noe2rc li{margin:10px;margin-bottom:5px;margin-left:20px;line-height:1.4em;}.css-58vpdc{margin-bottom:24px;}.css-58vpdc ul{margin:5px 0 10px 20px;}.css-58vpdc ul > br{display:none;}.css-58vpdc ul > li{margin-left:0;}.css-58vpdc li{padding:0;}Why are we hiring?

Machine Learning is revolutionizing the way of doing business at a global scale. In consumer lending business, Kreditech takes the technological forefront by developing proprietary technology that allows to automatically take accurate decisions based in multiple data sources in a fraction of seconds. YOU will contribute to further develop the in-house data science technology by engineering and productizing novel pipelines, pipelines and models.

A day in this job

Work closely with data scientists to operationalize proprietary machine learning technology to different problems such as: credit risk modeling, customer acquisition and retention, debt collection optimization, product personalization and conversion maximization;
Design and maintain scalable ETL infrastructure usable in multiple scenarios and applications (e.g.: data science/analytics, product, risk management);
Run machine learning tests and experiments.
Design and develop health and performance monitoring tools of data pipelines and the production machine learning technologies.
Design and improve heterogenous, asynchronous and high-performance large-data processing pipelines.
Demonstrate your leadership skills and manage a data-driven project or product;
Operationalize innovative, data-intensive, end-to-end fully automated machine-learning(ML)-based decision engines

Desired skills and experience

Personality: motivating attitude, profound communication and strong interpersonal skills
Experience and Knowledge: 2+ years of in-depth knowledge and professional working experience with software engineering, ETL pipelines and setting up machine learning workflows from preprocessing up to the final model, proficiency in Python and/or R, Experience in implementing and deploying REST microservices, Basic understanding of data science principles
Languages: fluent in English
Commitment to excellence and high professional and ethical standards;
We are looking for someone to start as soon as possible!

What is in it for you?

You will be joining a dynamic and diverse, multifunctional and multidisciplinary team of 10 data scientists plus one research oriented PhD student that collaborate to change the future of lending. We are passionate about designing, implementing, executing and monitoring our solutions in real world;
You will learn how to build, maintain and update production-ready data science artefacts at scale while leveraging in proprietary machine learning technology - which you can even create yourself.
You will feel the excitement of extracting value from data and impacting the performance of an entire organization. Kreditech is a 100% data science centered organization. The solutions productized by our team already personalized credit offers to more than 4 million individuals worldwide in the last 5 years. Out of those, our technology autonomously decided to lend more than 500 million euros. All of this happened with a 100% human free lead cycle;
You will join one of the fastest growing Fintech organizations;
You will work in an awesome office in the heart of Hamburg with the best views from the city and plenty of things to do nearby.

At Kreditech, we like to constantly challenge the status quo and improve our ways of working. We are a data driven company and believers of agile methods. Diversity is in our DNA and we strongly believe that having different perspectives, experiences and backgrounds will lead to the best environment for our employees and better products to our customers.

If this sounds like the kind of company you'd like to work with, please complete our online application.How to apply?

We accept applications exclusively through the application form below.
