Title: Manager, BI Analytics & Visualization
Blurb:
Company Description

McDonalds is proud to be one of the most recognized brands in the world, with restaurants in over 100 countries and billions of customers served each year. As the global leader in the food service industry, we have a legacy of innovation and hard work that continues to drive us. Today, we are growing with velocity and are focused on modernizing our experiences, not to make a different McDonalds, but to build a better McDonalds.
We are moving fast and are adding to our best-in-class team. Joining McDonald's means thinking big every day and preparing for a career that can have impact around the world. We are customer obsessed, committed to being leaders, and believe we are better when we work together. Over the last couple years, weve launched home delivery, modernized our restaurant experience through digital enhancements and have so much more to come.
We are dedicated to using our scale for good: good for people, our industry and the planet. From ambitious recycling initiatives and balanced sourcing efforts to our partnership with Ronald McDonald House Charities, we are constantly improving. We see every single day as a chance to have a genuine impact on our customers, our people and our partners.
Global Technology (U.S.) has an exciting opportunity for a Project Manager to join the Hardware Deployment team supporting our 14,000+ US restaurants. This team provides two key IT functions. The first is overseeing the selection, development & certification of all technology hardware and Operating Systems (OS) to support existing and future initiatives in the US restaurants. The second is to develop and plan a long-term hardware strategy that improves deployment and hardware/infrastructure capabilities focusing on performance, reliability and security. The successful candidate has knowledge of hardware, strong project management skills and thrives in a multifaceted, fast paced environment handling multiple high-profile initiatives with contending priorities and many stakeholders.
As a BI/Analytics Manager on our Digital Experience Analytics team, you will design and develop reports that drive daily business decisions. You should have a keen interest in combining data from multiple sources to create reporting, help drive decisions, and be passionate about breaking down complex business problems and providing well-design data visualization & analytical solutions that makes a significant impact!
Our Tableau Business Intelligence (BI) developer will create data visualization solutions to improve processes. This job involves tasks such as creating Tableau dashboard reports, working with the business team and developers, crafting business intelligence reports and visualizations, and attending feedback sessions to improve reports.
Must be able to support transformational efforts to create the next generation data delivery solutions. Must have a proven background in visual data delivery, interactive design and SQL with a passion for excellence. The candidate will be responsible for planning, designing, coordinating and developing highly interactive dashboards with built-in guided analytics for various lines of business using shared infrastructure.

Job Description

Create dashboards and reports within Tableau based on written requirements
Design, build, and deploy proof of concept solutions and create advanced BI visualization
Ability to interact with business users and understand their requirements
Thought partner on helping driving key KPIs and dashboards that align with business outcomes
Develop impactful presentations and documents that provide a logical narrative
Communicate complex topics to team through both written and oral communications
Ensure data is stored effectively and provide the ability to maintain the data analytics platform, so that data can optimally be mined for information at a later date
Conduct unit tests and develop database queries to analyze the effects and tackle any issues that arise
Evaluate and improve existing systems that are in place as well as collaborating with teams within the business to integrate these new systems to streamline workflows
Develop and update user documentation for senior leaders and colleagues to serve as a reference guide

Qualifications

Ideal candidate will have at least 5-7 years of meaningful work experience in a related field
Bachelors degree in engineering, statistics, business, or other field with a quantitative component is required; Masters degree preferred
Expertise with SQL and Alteryx is required
Experience in SAS, R, Python, or other programming language required
Experience with Tableau or other similar visualization tool
Along with technical skills candidate should have knowledge of one or more business areas (eCommerce, Marketing, Finance, Payments, etc.).
Experience with Agile, Lean, Six Sigma and/or proven process improvement expertise a plus
Knowledge of AWS or HADOOP is a plus
Ability to leverage critical thinking and analytical skills to improve business outcomes
Strong business acumen and knowledge of retail/QSR industry
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Self-motivated with ability to set priorities and mentor others in a performance driven environment
Comfortable working with a wide range of stakeholders and various levels of management, demonstrate influencing skills

ABOUT INSTACART

Founded in 2012, Instacart is a leader in North American online groceries and one of the fastest-growing companies in e-commerce. Our same-day delivery and pickup services bring everyday essentials and fresh groceries to consumers in the U.S. and Canada in as fast as an hour. We have partnered with more than 300 beloved national, regional and local retailers to deliver from more than 20,000 stores across more than 5,500 cities in North America.

We believe that great people are the ingredients for success. We like to think that we are like a potluckeveryone brings something new, different and flavorful to the table. We believe that just as meals are best shared together, success is best shared together. Our mix of thoughtful, inventive and neighborly employees work together to deliver our common goal: to make grocery shopping effortless for everyone. If this resonates with you, then Instacart just might be the place for you. Welcome home.

Title: Design Program Manager
Blurb:
OVERVIEW

Every year, people across the world spend nearly one trillion dollars on groceries. It's an industry that's been around for centuries. Food itself, however, has been a constant in people's lives since the beginning of time. Yes, sustenance is essential, but it's also much more than that. Food can be a part of a daily ritual or a special moment that resonates with people on a meaningful and emotional level. It can be a much-needed break in a long day, a taste that brings back memories, a creative experiment, a shared meal with loved ones, or even comfort during a hard time. Whether it's a special occasion or an everyday occurrence, it should always be easy for people to get the ingredients they need.

The Instacart Design Team is dedicated to making grocery shopping effortless for everyone and finding solutions to large-scale challenges that will forever change the way people feed themselves and their loved ones.

ABOUT THE JOB

As a Design Program Manager, you'll manage the design of feature development and execution across mobile & web applications. You will be joining a team that supports Instacart's growing portfolio of products and features. This team is responsible for creating the core product experiences that will be the foundation for our Consumer platform.
In this role you will help drive, communicate and implement Instacart's passion for design  this includes driving the creation of best practices, collaborating with product design, product management and engineers and work closely with our Design Leadership to coordinate efforts across concurrent launch cycles


Drive product design initiatives within and between Design, Product Management, Legal, Brand, Marketing, and Engineering teams.
Coordinate software build releases with internal stakeholders.
Develop strategy for engaging Design team with numerous Product Management and Engineering teams.
Prioritize feature definition, facilitate and coordinate UX design research and implementation, and drive execution.
Manage external vendors, contractors, and developers as needed to support product deliverables.
Participate in and help facilitate design brainstorming and work sessions
Communicate with engineers through the implementation phase to realize design vision

ABOUT YOU


You are detail-oriented while being able to see the big picture
You make a great thought partner with the cross-functional teams
You are an excellent storyteller and communicator
You exude can-do attitude and enthusiasm
You are self-aware and humble

Qualifications


5+ years experience in program management.
5+ years of experience in managing interactive, design, and/or creative projects .
Meticulous sense of detail
Demonstrates the ability to work confidently through partnerships with Product Design, Product Management, User Research, Brand, and Engineering
Experience in allocating team members accordingly against shifting priorities.
Experience with bug tracking software, apps release processes, and software support needs.
Ability to understand and discuss technical topics, requirements, and limitations related to software development.
Ability to drive feature definition from ambiguity
Excellent communication, presentation, and organizational skills

ABOUT INSTACART

Founded in 2012, Instacart is the leader in North American online groceries and one of the fastest-growing companies in e-commerce. Our same-day delivery and pickup services bring everyday essentials and fresh groceries to consumers in the U.S. and Canada in as fast as an hour. We have partnered with more than 300 beloved national, regional and local retailers to deliver from more than 20,000 stores across more than 5,500 cities in North America.

We believe that great people are the ingredients for success. We like to think that we're like a potluckeveryone brings something new, different, and flavorful to the table. We believe that just as meals are best shared together, success is best shared together. Our mix of thoughtful, inventive and neighborly employees work together to deliver our common goal: To make grocery shopping effortless for everyone. If this resonates with you, then Instacart just might be the place for you. Welcome home.

Title: iOS Engineer
Blurb:
OVERVIEW

At Instacart, our mobile engineers are working to delight our customers and empower our shoppers. We're building a robust, well-architected app to simplify the complex process of getting our customer's orders from the store to their door in an hour or less.

We're looking for iOS engineers to build the mobile apps at the core of Instacart's business. On the customer side, our mobile engineers are tasked with building a flexible and intuitive app for all of our customersfrom the technologically savvy to those who just got their first iPhone. On the Shopper side, developers are building a critical tool that guides shoppers through the store as they select items for our customers, all the way through last-mile logistics and delivery. On the Enterprise side, our mobile engineers are developing white-label products and APIs that let retailers build and maintain their own digital storefronts.

ABOUT THE JOB

In your application, please include a short note about your background and interests, your Github username, and/or links to any projects that represent your skill set.


Executing a variety of projects to extend and enhance our Instacart application for iPhone and iPad
Building new features to create an experience nothing short of magical

ABOUT YOU


Bachelor's degree in computer science is preferred with 2+ years of software development experience and at least 3 years of iOS app development experience
Very strong development skills in Swift and Objective C, iOS SDK, and good general programming and algorithm skills
Superior analytical skills and a strong sense of urgency and ownership in your work
Proven customer facing application development, troubleshooting, deployment and application performance tuning experience
Proven ability to build, launch and iterate on apps under pressure
Willing and able to travel internationally based on job requirements

ABOUT INSTACART

Founded in 2012, Instacart is a leader in North American online groceries and one of the fastest-growing companies in e-commerce. Our same-day delivery and pickup services bring everyday essentials and fresh groceries to consumers in the U.S. and Canada in as fast as an hour. We have partnered with more than 300 beloved national, regional and local retailers to deliver from more than 20,000 stores across more than 5,500 cities in North America.

We believe that great people are the ingredients for success. We like to think that we are like a potluckeveryone brings something new, different and flavorful to the table. We believe that just as meals are best shared together, success is best shared together. Our mix of thoughtful, inventive and neighborly employees work together to deliver our common goal: to make grocery shopping effortless for everyone. Title: Salesforce Administrator
Blurb:
The GoGuardian Revenue Operations team is looking for a Salesforce Administrator. You will become an expert in all areas of our current Salesforce configuration, optimize our instances for efficiency and usability, and collaborate on future Salesforce projects, processes, and integrations.

Nearly every department at GoGuardian interacts with Salesforce in a unique way. Whenever someone finds a bug, has an amazing idea, or identifies a new requirement, you will proudly be there to brainstorm and develop excellent solutions for them!
You love to...
...solve puzzles. Whether debugging, finding data issues, or planning how to build that new piece of automation, you enjoy the journey of figuring it all out.
...dig in. You cant wait to tackle the challenges of understanding and building upon complex systems of process automation and data accuracy.
...build for the future. You know your work is to build and scale as fast as the business.
...team up. You look forward to brainstorming with your team at the beginning of new projects, and you recognize that providing transparency for other teams help keep them in the loop.
...provide awesome customer service. You may not get to talk with our customers very often, but you know our internal customers are just as important.
We know youll be successful if you have:
2+ years overall Salesforce experience
A passion for creating data visibility through reports and dashboards
Experience working with relational data
Expertise with declarative automation (ex. Process Builders, Workflow Rules, and Flows)
An understanding of sales processes within Salesforce
A habit of excellent communication
The ability to work independently, as well as part of a team on multiple projects
An interest in quickly leveling up to become a Salesforce Developer
A bit more:
In your first two months youll leave no Salesforce-stone unturned as you delve into the entire tech stack integrated with our Salesforce instance, all of our declarative automation, and the structure and relationships of our data. The next 2 months youll begin to look for areas for optimization, understand our current and future priorities, and take on some projects!
GoGuardian is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions on the basis of merit and business needs. Title: Technical Product Manager
Blurb:
At GoGuardian, Product Managers are the champions of discovering user problems that need to be solved. GoGuardians Product Management Team is given the creative freedom and trust necessary to arrive at innovative and industry-leading solutions, supported by incredible design and engineering teams. Were a team of passionate creators who believe in the power of education and its ability to impact the future trajectory of our youth.

As a Technical Product Manager, you will be the loudest advocate for your users. You will use your strong technical aptitude and in depth understanding of the K-12 space to own the short and long term technical strategy of our platform, ensuring our solutions work seamlessly and consistently across any device and operating system. Every decision youll make will be on behalf of your users. Youll define and carry out the technical solutions vision for them and will champion it through the entire organization while also managing tactical initiatives

Were looking for someone who thrives in an environment of trust, optimism, and consistent questioning of status quo. We trust our Product Management team to define the future of GoGuardian, and in-turn, the future of our impact on education.
What will I be doing?
You will own the technical strategy, roadmap, and backlog for ensuring GG solutions work seamlessly and consistently across any device and operating system
You will work closely with other PMs and developers to maintain consistent user experience, address top technological needs on all devices, and be the subject matter expert for all devices/platforms/clients used in K-12 space
You will regularly conduct competitive technical capability analyses and assess emerging products to measure their potential value or threat to GoGuardian and its products, as well as make recommendations on which new technologies to invest in or leverage
You will substantiate recommendations with metrics that demonstrate impact/risk on our business and constantly define, measure, and share the success of your solution through both quantitative and qualitative measures
You will work closely with design, developers, QA, and your fellow PMs to define a process that ensures ongoing support of functionality on all devices
Youll deeply understand the problems that your users are experiencing through research and interaction with customers, and then communicate those problems clearly back to your team
What skills do I need?
You have 2+ years of experience of product ownership/management experience
You have exceptional verbal and written communication skills and are comfortable speaking with both internal and external stakeholders
You have a proven track record of engaging in technical conversations with developers and can switch to translate your highly technical solutions to non-technical internal and external stakeholders
You have developed key performance indicators to measure success/impact of your work and can speak to decisions youve made to improve those metrics
You substantiate any product decisions by proving, or disproving, their validity with experimentation and measurable results using qualitative and quantitative data
You can clearly communicate the vision of your solutions, the roadmap, and the rationale behind them. Youre comfortable making decisions without consensus. You know when and how to equip other business units to further support your product and value product alignment
You have an understanding of the technical architecture of complex & modern web applications. Youre able to tailor the level of technical communication based on the audience the room
Extra Credit
A background in Computer Science or Software Engineering
Experience working on mobile and desktop environments
Experience working within Google, Microsoft, iOS, Android, MacOS platforms (or any combination thereof)
What else will help me succeed?
You love facilitating conversations with customers and translating their needs into a solution
You are a true team player and thrive on collaborating with others to determine the best path forward for your users
You incorporate user impact metrics as part of your success metrics (you do not build just to drive revenue and do not build anything without customer validation)
Youve also built products that have failed (and know why they did)
You value and favor user needs and concerns over your own to inform product direction
You regularly use data to objectively evaluate ideas and assumptions
You understand and value the importance of quantitative and qualitative data
You know when and how its appropriate to say no
You possess a passion for education or EdTech
You are a natural advocate and evangelist, willing and eager to talk about the value of your solution to anyone at any time
What attitudes and mindsets will enable me to be successful at GoGuardian?
You are constantly looking for new opportunities to personally grow
You approach problems with modesty and a beginners mindset
You are collaborative in your approach and are always looking for opportunities to engage peers and other functional groups
You value diverse perspectives and backgrounds
You welcome and apply feedback
You approach problems with a data-driven mindset, building a hypothesis and proving its validity with experimentation
You consistently challenge the status quo. You would never implement a tool or process with the reason: Thats how weve always done it

Title: Sr. Software Engineer (Full Stack)
Blurb:
Classy's Product Technology team is hiring a Senior Full-Stack Software Engineer to build and extend our fundraising products, analytics platform, and visualization tools for the next phase of our business. The ideal candidate is well-versed in full stack development and comfortable in creating all layers of the application from database through to the user interface. We want to talk to you if you can see beyond the {brackets} and love transforming designs and mockups into highly-scalable, fault-tolerant products.

---------------------

What you'll do:
---------------------


Analyze, design, and develop software that delivers clean, maintainable code within a large, complex, and established code base.
Learn and grow your skills by working collaboratively with experienced and engaged developers to design new features and re-architect existing ones.
Within an Agile environment, work as part of a Scrum team and develop web-based software solutions.
Mentor engineers to become proficient developers using best software development practices and processes.

What you bring (Required):

Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or a related field, or equivalent work experience.
5+ years of professional software development experience with server-side, web-based technologies (full stack preferred)
Excellent understanding of distributed software architecture with experience debugging distributed systems with high data loads.
High-level proficiency with Javascript ES6, Node.js, PHP, React and/or Angular, Linux.
Familiarity with GraphQL, Elasticsearch, Docker, AWS (EC2, ECS, Lambda, SNS).
Ability to understand product requirements and translate them into technical subtasks.
Experience with Scrum/Agile development methodologies.
Proficiency in schema design in relational or NoSQL databases (MySQL, MongoDB).
Deep experience with code versioning tools (GIT/Bitbucket).
A deep sense of quality, and sharp engineering skills with strong computer science fundamentals.

------------------------------------------

What would be awesome to have (Preferred):
------------------------------------------


Experience with refactoring complex architecture to microservice patterns
Experience with payment systems (Stripe, Cybersource, WePay)
Experience building PCI compliant systems

Our amazing perks!


Unlimited PTO
10 half-day Fridays a year
20 hours paid volunteer time off
Monthly parking pass, public transit pass, or rideshare allowance
Supplemental Medical/Dental/Vision Insurance, available day one
401(k) plan
Dog friendly office
Fitness membership discounts
Love the active life? We have company and team outings and participate in team sports
Monthly employee development courses
New expansive office in downtown San Diego overlooking Petco Park baseball stadium and the ocean

About Classy

Classy is a social enterprise that creates world-class online fundraising software for nonprofits, modernizing the giving experience to accelerate social impact around the world. Recognized as one of the most valuable tech startups in San Diego, Classy is trusted by organizations of all sizes, from the fastest-growing nonprofits like Team Rubicon and The Trevor Project, to some of the world's largest social organizations, such as The Salvation Army, Robin Hood Foundation, and Shriners Hospitals for Children. Working for Classy means you're an integral part of our missionto mobilize and empower the world for goodand our unique culture. You'll learn, contribute to amazing customer experiences, and flourish alongside colleagues who are determined to make a lasting social impact. For more information, visit www.classy.org ( http://www.classy.org/ ) or follow Classy on Twitter @Classy.

Dedication to Diversity

Classy is working toward building a more diverse and inclusive environment that is representative of individuals of all backgrounds, experiences, and lifestyles, allowing all employees to feel comfortable being their true, authentic selves in a space that enables productivity and meaningful work.
